note: This is the geographic region where the Appalachian Dialect is spoken; the boundaries are fuzzy; thewestern boundary is the NC/TN border, the southern boundary are the NC-SC and NC-GA borders, the north boundary is the NC-VA border, and the eastern boundary is a northeast line intersecting Hickory.

This is the geographic region where the Piedmont Dialect is spoken; the boundaries are fuzzy, with Hickory on the western border, Zebulon on the east border, Louisburg on the northern border, and the state border on the south border.

This is the geographic region where the VA Piedmont Dialect is spoken; the boundaries are fuzzy, centered around Lousiburg on the southern border,  the state border with Virginia on the northern border, and stretching west and east within a hundred miles of the full width of the northern border of the state.

This is the geographic region where the Coastal Plains Dialect is spoken; the boundaries are fuzzy; the western border is just west of robeson county and cuts northeast to the virginia border; the southern border is the NC-SC border, the easternborder is the Atlantic Ocean, excepting the lands immediately surrounding the Pamlico Sound as well as the Outer Banks.

This is the geographic region where the Outer Banks Dialect is spoken; the boundaries are fuzzy; this area imakes up the lands immediately surrounding the Pamlico Sound, including Hyde County, as well as the Outer Banks.
The sociogeographic dialect of Lumbee English and the Lumbee population are centered around Robeson County, NC.
